str2: Therefore, then. Apparently a primary word; certainly, or accordingly.
Much, many; often.
From a derivative of echo; a throng; by implication, the rabble; by extension, a class of people; figuratively, a riot.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
Jewish. From Iouda; Judaean, i.e. Belonging to Jehudah.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolonged form of a primary verb; to 'know' in a great variety of applications and with many implications.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
(a) there, yonder, in that place, (b) thither, there. Of uncertain affinity; there; by extension, thither.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To come, go.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.
Alone, but, only. Neuter of monos as adverb; merely.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.
And, even, also, namely.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.
Probably of Hebrew origin; Lazarus, the name of two Israelites.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: Who, which, what, that.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I wake, arouse, (b) I raise up. Probably akin to the base of agora; to waken, i.e. Rouse.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
(a) adj: dead, lifeless, subject to death, mortal, (b) noun: a dead body, a corpse. From an apparently primary nekus; dead.
